name: forging, steel, large open die | forging, steel | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/11753/documentation

 This dataset represents the service of forging steel in large open die press cylindrical or block shapes. The forged pieces weigh from 2 to 25 tonnes. It includes heat treatment, machining and final inspection. Production of metal in final piece is excluded. Input and output steel associated with losses are included and are on average 24% final forged piece.This dataset is based on forging and machining activity of an integrated forge working with variety of steel alloys. 

Starts with the delivery of material and energy inputs on site.

This activity ends with the machined cylindrical or block steel shapes.
The dataset includes: the forging proceses (including heating oven and open die forging (5 kt and 2 kt presses), scarfing, and heat treatment); the machining processes (including cutting, milling and turning); and finally non-destructive testing (NDT). This dataset excludes: hot top and metal residues in canals that are internally recycled and reprensents less that 1% of production materials. It also excludes oily wastewater (approx. 1ml/kg - 5%-95% oil emulsion in water).
category: C:Manufacturing/24:Manufacture of basic metals/241:Manufacture of basic iron and steel/2410:Manufacture of basic iron and steel

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Dataset is extrapolated from the dataset of the Québec region, as to represent the global production.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: This dataset is based on the average technique of the Québec region.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: This dataset is based on primary data from Quebec region and technology and is extrapolate for the world. Uncertainty was change accordingly. Some of the flows in this dataset have been directly copied from the ecoinvent 3.0 dataset "hot rolling, steel, GLO, 2002", the uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Primary data collected from one large open-die forge in Québec.
